titleStmt.title: Some queries, proposed to discover the necessity of magistrates and laws: and engaging to defend both They are writ for those sakes who are not yet come into so great a measure of light and love, and charity, as to bear all things, and to see all things lawful: 'tis light that discovers the lawfulness of things, and charity bears them; and 'tis love that fulfils all law; (and these three are one:) and when all law is fulfilled, or fulled full, where then is there place in such, for unlawful, or law unfilled?
titleStmt.author: Jenings, Francis.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
